text: The Saturday Evening Post is an American magazine. It started publication in 1897. Its origins are traced to Benjamin Franklin's colonial newspaper The Pennsylvania Gazette. The Post was famous for its covers by Norman Rockwell and the single-panel comic strip Hazel by Ted Key. Contents included short fiction, poetry, and humor. Jack London's novel The Call of the Wild was first published in the Post in 1903. ==Other websites== Category:American weekly magazines Category:1897 establishments in the United States
title: The Saturday Evening Post
